intro: Tapeinia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered tapeinia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tapeinia longiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitats.
